channel.title: ComputeCode
channel.description: A blog about security, software, and hardware.

item.title: Design Changes and Updates
item.description: An overview of what has been done and what has changed.

item.title: An Analysis of the Zoom Video Conferencing Client for Linux
item.description: A shallow deep-dive into the Zoom client for Linux in an attempt to find some vulnerabilities.

item.title: ActiveAntiPhish - Protecting Stolen Credentials Using Saturation
item.description: Phishkits. What they are, where to find them, and how to defend against them. Plus a little bit of knowledge found on the underground.

item.title: DeMux - MuxHat in software form
item.description: Installation and usage instructions for the DeMux flashing utility.

item.title: Commenteer - Code Commenting Made Easy
item.description: A new project designed to make comment header addition to existing source code a bit easier.

item.title: Upcoming Firmware Flasher for 2011 MacBook gMux
item.description: An announcement regarding a recent pre-release video as well as a scam alert for those seeking repairs.

item.title: DyingLight - Software and Hardware to Bring Back Brightness Functionality of MacBooks.
item.description: Backlight control for MacBooks with dead dedicated graphics chips. Allowing for seamless control of the backlight brighness via specially designed drivers and hardware.

item.title: Local Privilege Escalation in Certiport Testing Software
item.description: When vendors ignore least privilege guidelines you end up with local admin in a secure testing facility. The story of Pearson and their CertiPort software.
